verb.description: Obtain or secure (something desired, favorable, or profitable)
examples: their blend of acoustic folk pop gained them several chart hits
a process that has gained the confidence of the industry

verb.description: Increase the amount or rate of (something, typically weight or speed)
examples: I have gained weight over the years

noun.description: An increase in wealth or resources.
examples: the mayor was accused of using municipal funds for personal gain

origin: Late 15th century (as a noun, originally in the sense booty): from Old French gaigne (noun), gaignier (verb), of Germanic origin.
